title: Microenterprise Loan Fund Act 2012 (No. 31 of 2012), and with the consent of
heading: (a) These Regulations may be cited as the Microenterprise Loan
text_raw:
1. 

 (a) These Regulations may be cited as the Microenterprise Loan 

Fund Scheme (Amendment) Regulations 2020. 

(b) The Microenterprise Loan Fund Scheme 2015 (S.I. No. 
393/2015) and these Regulations are to be construed together as 
one. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 (a) regulation may cited microenterprise loan fund scheme (amendment) regulation 2020 (b) microenterprise loan fund scheme 2015 (s.i no 393 2015) regulation construed together one interpretation

title: Microenterprise Loan Fund Act 2012 (No. 31 of 2012), and with the consent of
heading: In these Regulations-
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations- 

 “Principal Regulations” means the Microenterprise Loan Fund Scheme 
2015 (S.I. No. 393/2015). 

“COVID-19” means an infectious disease as listed in the Schedule to 
the Infectious Diseases Regulations 1981 (S.I. No. 390 of 1981) as 
amended by regulation 3(d) of the Infectious Diseases (Amendment) 
Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 53/2020). 

Amendment of Regulation 5.1.2 of the Principal Regulations – Purpose of Loan
text_norm: 2 regulations- principal regulation mean microenterprise loan fund scheme 2015 (s.i no 393 2015) covid-19 mean infectious disease listed schedule infectious disease regulation 1981 (s.i no 390 1981) amended regulation 3(d) infectious disease (amendment) regulation 2020 (s.i no 53 2020) amendment regulation 5.1.2 principal regulation - purpose loan

title: Microenterprise Loan Fund Act 2012 (No. 31 of 2012), and with the consent of
heading: 3. The Principal Regulations are amended by substituting for Regulation
text_raw: 3. The Principal Regulations are amended by substituting for Regulation

title: Microenterprise Loan Fund Act 2012 (No. 31 of 2012), and with the consent of
heading: 5.1.2 the following:
text_raw:
5.1.2 the following: 

“5.1.2 Purpose of Loan 

Loans will be provided for business start-up costs, expansion 
costs and working capital. 

Loans above €25,000 will be exclusively provided for 
microenterprises where a minimum of 15% of actual or 
projected turnover or profit is negatively impacted 
by COVID-19.” 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 20th March, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [78] 3 

Amendment of Regulation 5.1.3 of the Principal Regulations –Permissible 
Loan Values

title: Microenterprise Loan Fund Act 2012 (No. 31 of 2012), and with the consent of
heading: 4. The Principal Regulations are amended by substituting for Regulation
text_raw: 4. The Principal Regulations are amended by substituting for Regulation

title: Microenterprise Loan Fund Act 2012 (No. 31 of 2012), and with the consent of
heading: 5.1.3 the following:
text_raw:
5.1.3 the following: 

“5.1.3 Permissible Loan Values 

Loans will be for amounts up to €25,000. 

Where the increased permissible value in Regulation 5.1.2. 
applies, loans will be for amounts up to €50,000. This increased 
permissible value will apply until 1st April 2021.” 

Given under the Official Seal of the Minister for Business, 

Enterprise and Innovation, 

13 March, 2020. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Business, Enterprise and Innovation. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Finance, 

13 March, 2020. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 
Minister for Finance. 

Given under the Official Seal of the Minister for Public 

Expenditure and Reform , 

13 March, 2020. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform.
